intro: Bilabrella orthocaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bilabrella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or pale purple in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
